content: the sweet little baby s breath preemie beanie pattern features a gorgeous floral design on the crown with cluster stitches leading down to a delicate scalloped brim these hats were specially designed using flat textures that are beautiful but won t irritate little heads crochet them with a soft fingering weight sock yarn of your choice **difficulty ** advanced *techniques used working in back bar of single_crochet working in blo spike stitches clusters elizabeth stitches shell stitches* **materials needed ** 55-95 yards #1 sock weight yarn here are some you can try -loops & threads woolike acrylic note this yarn is discontinued but you may have some in your stash that you need to use up or you can use the yarnsub site to find a close match -knit picks comfy fingering weight yarn cotton -hand-dyed superwash merino wool/nylon blend sock yarn either undyed or in the color of your choice 2mm steel hook or hook needed to obtain gauge yarn needle scissors stitch markers optional **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet decrease = single_crochet 2 together invisible decrease insert hook through front loop of next 2 sts yo pull up a loop yo pull through 2 **additional terms ** elizabeth stitch insert hook into st yo draw up a loop yo insert hook into same st draw up a loop yo pull through all 4 loops on hook these stitches should be as tall as a single_crochet stitch back bar of single_crochet = look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all designated stitches for the round into this bar this is a different location than the back loop blo = back loop only 3dc cluster = yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 1st stitch of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 2nd st of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 3rd st of cluster made yo draw through all loops on hook st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces skip = skip prev = previous **measurements ** * these are approximate measurements * 8 head circumference 3-4 lb preemie hat 4 wide by 3 ¼ tall 10 head circumference 4-5 lb preemie hat 5 wide by 3 ¾ tall 12 head circumference 5-6 lb preemie/newborn hat 6 wide by 4 ¾ tall **gauge ** 2 across after round 6 with #1 yarn and 2mm hook **additional notes ** -chain-1 or chain-2 at beginning of a round do not count as a stitch unless otherwise indicated -please check with your local nicu before beginning this project you will want to make sure that you are using the right kind of yarn and crocheting the beanie sizes that they have the most need of
